e4: Continuing a policy of intentional bias, even if understood by some investors, is ethically problematic. The new policy promotes honesty and transparency, building trust with all investors in the long run.  While short-term market reactions are a concern, they should be weighed against the ethical imperative for accurate financial reporting.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy.  It provides a clear, unbiased representation of the company's financial performance, accessible to all stakeholders without manipulation or hidden agendas. While short-term market considerations are valid, they shouldn't overshadow the fundamental principle of honest communication. Long-term trust and sustainable growth are best fostered through ethical reporting practices.
e6: Yes, I would have follow-up questions for management:  1) What concrete steps will be taken to communicate the policy change transparently to all investors? 2) How will we mitigate potential short-term market volatility and address concerns of retail investors? 3) What long-term benefits do we anticipate from adopting a more ethical reporting practice?
